segments.text: I see the boy standing on that stool, reaching for the cookies, and I feel so scared for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already tipping, and he's so focused on the cookie jar that he doesn't notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he's going to fall and hurt himself, and no one is there to catch him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice his sister is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, oblivious to the water and the kids behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should run over and steady the stool, but I'm frozen in place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why no one else is seeing what I'm seeing, why no one is doing anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is being so brave, standing up there like that, but it's also so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the open window, the calm garden outside, and it feels so surreal compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a disaster about to happen, and I can't do anything to stop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think I need to say something, to warn them, but I'm so afraid I'll startle the boy and make him fall.
segments.speaker: PAR
